result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamillia Marie Brown

records.addlTxt: Defendant has two other pending cases set before Judge Watts, Branch 15. Branch 15 is willing to take the cases from Branch 30 for a global resolution.

Court allowing time for Defendant to appear for book and release.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10-23-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10-13-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Macy's.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jamillia Marie Brown in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed:  No Contact Order
Received and Filed:  Proposed No Contact Order

ADDRESS INFO for Jamillia Marie Brown
Current: 3025 W Mitchell St, Milwaukee, WI 53215 United States  (Effective: 09-23-2022)
Prior: 4879 North 39th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Jamillia Marie Brown not in court.  Attorney Samuel Tabin in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/10/22 @ 1p
